The heart of an embryo starts to beat from around 5–6 weeks of pregnancy. Also, it may be possible to see the first visible sign of the embryo, known as the fetal pole, at this stage.

replies.context: Nope.  .First, there is no heart as people think of it, until about 10 weeks so there can't be a beat, again as we think of it, until then.  A heart beat is the contraction of the heart muscle chambers which cause blood to move around.  At 6 weeks, there are no chambers.  What is detected on ultrasound is called "flutter."  It's random electrical discharges from what will become the heart's pacemaker.  Of course, the rest of Abrams' statement is pure stupidity but there ya go.
